title: Based Alt-History Books
author: VD
content_html:
Aetherczar has announced the first niche Based Book Sale, with a smaller selection of books more tightly focused around a single genre.

The debut sale focuses on alternative history books, and includes new arrivals like James Young’s military alt-history, Dispatches from Valhalla, K.B. Condi’s American Revolution secret history Quest for Harmony, and Joseph Knowles, Defying Conventions, about a secret conspiracy to sabotage the Constitutional Convention.

The sale also includes returning sale favorites like Travis Corcoran’s Firefly Season 2 about the cross timeline trade in bootleg cultural artifacts, Robert Kroese’s Dream of the Iron Dragon in which crashed space travelers from the future enlist Vikings to build a spaceship and take them home, Fenton Wood’s secret history of the young protagonists who had to hack NASA’s Galileo space probe to thwart an alien threat, Hacking Galileo, and Aetherczar’s A Rambling Wreck in which freshmen thwart a social justice takeover at an alternate timeline Georgia Tech.

The Alternate History Based Book Sale runs through Tuesday March 25.
